body: idk why you didn't include the conclusions from the discussion -- the easiest fix is to history-only merge tags into mainline as they are released to mark them as released
Sorry, I missed that bit as it was not clear to me how it can be done. I guess an additional github action that runs on tags-create that does this,... if it can be done in a safe way.

@asottile what do you mean by "history-only merge tags into mainline as they are released" ? (Maybe a git command I don't know ?)

 We have a 2.7 branch with only the bug fixes for 2.7 cherry-picked here. Say D is a bug fix and C a feature :

```
2.7.0 - C - D <-master
    \
      D' <- 2.7
```

What should we do when we release ? If we merge 2.7 in master before tagging master, then we ship C which is meant for 2.8 in 2.7.1 and we don't want that. 

```
2.7.0 - C - D - 2.7.1 <-master
    \             /
      D' -         <- 2.7
```

We could rebase master on 2.7 and tag on D', but then we don't want to rewrite master either.

```
A - 2.7.0 - D' (2.7.1) - C' <-master rebased
```

~~Also what would be the problem with ``pre-commit autoupdate`` getting the latest tag on any branches ?~~ Edit : Nervermind, we want to be able to release an alpha for 3.0.0.

Here is how to perform a history-only merge marking a tag as released:

```console
$ git describe --tags --abbrev=0
pylint-2.6.0
$ git merge --no-edit --strategy=ours pylint-2.7.2
Merge made by the 'ours' strategy.
$ git describe --tags --abbrev=0
pylint-2.7.2
```

note that `--strategy=ours` means that *no changes* are integrated from the tag

> Also what would be the problem with pre-commit autoupdate getting the latest tag on any branches ?

- there isn't really a way to discover all branches from a remote repository
- there may be tags on feature branches that shouldn't be considered (and no reasonable way to filter them out)
- a maintenance tag may be tagged on an old release that's not newer than the latest release (newer by date)
- "oh well just look at all tags globally and pick the latest version" - tags are just strings, there's no valid comparison method (pylint for instance would fail parsing as a version due to it's very-non-standard tagging scheme)

issue.title: Update the release documentation for pre-commit autoupdate to works

We're going to release 2.7.3 soonish and the problem will fix itself by following the new release process introduced in #4247 .
